"not an important enough thing to care about addressing" Was he not punished?
If Riot didn't care about the issue, it seems unlikely that they would even bring up that it was going on.

Because punishing someone to get even isn't constructive. This sends the message it's not ok *and* allows the chance to reform. He is more likely to learn the error of his ways if he's forced to master his bad behavior in an environment where he has incentive to do so.

TLDR: I think this punishment is fair; this is about changing the whole community not just one toxic player. You need a chance for reform and not just permabans to do that.

How can you think they are saying it's "okay" and "not addressing" when they just ended his shot at going pro this spring. It is addressed right here in this announcement (basically a public shaming). This a pretty major thing to take away what these players strive for and I'm happy they did so. I would have also been okay with a perma ban here but I don't think that's the answer to every abusive player. This highlights their push for reform across the playerbase. This is the first time he's received anything more than a chat restriction, hopefully he becomes civil now. If not they will not be lenient next time or then I will agree with you.

Bear in mind that these types of suspensions are reviewed at the end of their term and if the person hasn't shown improvement, they'll be restricted again. The suspension is really just the 'minimum term' of the punishment, not the potential length of it.

They're just giving him a split to reform, if he doesn't, we'll hear that his suspension has been extended. If he does, we'll hear the opposite.

But being suspended from competitive play is a far harsher punishment than having his personal account closed... since the latter is 'just a video game account', while the former is potentially the death of a long time dream that he's been working towards. If ANYTHING is going to get him to reform, it'll be that... so it makes sense to give him that chance.
